intro: Ricinocarpus chamaedrifolius, commonly known as the creeping ricinocarp, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow flowers followed by distinctive, three-lobed seed pods. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
